     Demonstrated self-awareness of personal perceptions, building team rapport in a diverse environment, and active listening
     Builds strong, diverse relationships that support accomplishment of business goals
     History of managing own priorities and helping others manage competing priorities
     Receives and acts on feedback from customers; history of giving feedback to others
     Demonstrated ability to mentor developing engineers and focus on developing own knowledge base
     Experience where digital/high-value tools were used to impact business results or lower carbon
     Develops creative solutions to overcome barriers for self and others
     Demonstrated ability to manage diverse workload for multiple customers and be willing to support domestic and international operating facilities with occasional multi-week technical consulting roles.
     History of concisely and credibly communicating (orally and in writing) effectively with customers, peers, and leadership to achieve results.
   
   
    Preferred Qualifications:
   
     Equipment knowledge base needed can include rotating equipment (pumps, gas & steam turbines, centrifugal and positive displacement compressors) and/or fixed equipment (tanks, piping, valves, pressure vessels, heat exchangers).
     Knowledge base can also include scoping and managing small projects.

Join our Team
Chevron’s strategy is straight-forward: be a leader in efficient and lower carbon production of traditional energy, in high demand today and for decades to come, while growing lower carbon businesses that will be a bigger part of the future. To achieve these goals, we’ll build on the assets, experience, capabilities, and relationships we’ve developed over 140 years to incubate and grow new business.

We differentiate ourselves through the application of cutting-edge technology, and by taking a collaborative approach that includes in-house expertise, proprietary solutions, and strategic partnerships. We also offer flexible work schedules and very competitive benefits.
Join Chevron IT. Lend us your skills and enjoy a great career with Chevron.
Chevron's Business Intelligence Analyst is accountable for understanding data in the larger context of the business and the value chain to transform data into insights for better decision-making through scientific exploration, analytics, and data. The BI Analyst is responsible for leading data analytics initiatives within Chevron business by performing data analysis, translating data requirements to technical requirements, and driving insights to business problems and decisions.
Responsibilities for this position may include but are not limited to:
Work closely with the product owner and business stakeholders as a member of agile team
Have an in-depth understanding of business problem in hand
Access, gather, and analyze data from source systems
Help frame the business problem by providing quantitative and qualitative data analysis (data quality, availability, etc.)
Drive insights to business problems by visualizing the data and telling a story through data (report patterns, trends, anomalies, etc.)
Contribute to data analysis, data wrangling, data visualization, and user acceptance testing
Present findings and new development to help refine backlog items
Required Qualifications:
Minimum 5 years of experience in data visualization
Experience working with various data sources and connections
Experience in data modeling and understanding of data architecture
Familiar with data visualization tool (Microsoft Power BI, TIBCO Spotfire)
Data modeling (such as Azure Analysis Services)
Data wrangling tools and language (Python, Databricks, for example)
Preferred Education
B.S. or M.S. in Business Analytics, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Mathematics or Engineering

   Chevron is accepting online applications for the position of Legal Administrative Assistant located in Houston, TX through May 11th, 2022 at 11:59 p.m.
   
    This position supports ten (12) Chevron lawyers, who manage Chevron’s major transactions. This group is comprised of lawyers who handle U.S and international matters across the value chain. The international team travels internationally and must attend calls and virtual meetings across a variety of time zones. The individual will report to the Manager of Legal Services, Upstream.
   
    The salary range for this position is between $76,000 - $78,000 a year plus competitive benefits and bonus.
   
    This position requires a high level of initiative, accuracy, and attention to detail. This position also requires an individual who has a positive, can-do attitude, strong interpersonal skills, excellent problem-solving skills, is proactive, has demonstrated the ability to multitask and manage high volume of work and works well independently as well as in teams. The position works closely with other Chevron law groups outside of the U.S. and outside legal organizations.

     Proficiency in SharePoint, iManage and MS office applications: Outlook, Forms, Word (Advanced Features), PowerPoint, Team Connect, CTREX.

     Notary

     Demonstrated strong interpersonal skills.

title: Reservoir Engineer
description:
Chevron is accepting online applications for the position Reservoir Engineer through May 10th, 2022 at 11:59 p.m. (CDT).

Responsibilities for this position may include but are not limited to:
Responsible for Recovery Mechanisms/Mechanistic Modeling Research & Development for Conventional/Unconventional Reservoirs with focus on Surfactant-Gas EOR.
Position builds functional excellence in recovery mechanisms & mechanistic modeling in surfactant-gas EOR in conventional and unconventional reservoirs. Along with group lead, ensures Chevron’s leading position in first principles reservoir engineering and understanding of producing mechanisms with focus on surfactant-gas options related to gas EOR/cyclic gas injection in conventional and unconventional reservoirs. Responsibilities include strong teaming with Chevron subsurface subject matter experts and Schlumberger to incorporate mechanistic models into the IX simulator. Will work closely with the Chevron Technical Center’s labs and help guide first principles research and/or experiments that drive resource to reserves to production to financial returns. Will develop conceptual models, micro-models, mechanistic sim., etc. Will team with the subsurface data platform-digital organization in data analytics (ML, AI, etc.). Will direct work with vendors, academic research, and national labs. Will assist with teaming, functional excellence and organizational capability development.
Required Qualifications:
PhD in Chemical or Petroleum Engineering
Experience in surfactant/surfactant-gas EOR R&D in with an emphasis on complex mechanisms, e.g., surfactant structure property modeling relating EOR performance to surfactant formulation.
Preferred Qualifications:
Working knowledge of hydrocarbon recovery concepts and applications.
Solid background in conceptual models, molecular simulation, micro-models, and mechanistic simulation and reservoir simulation.
Experience working in labs or closely with labs and guiding first principles research and/or experiments that drive the understanding of surfactant/surfactant-gas EOR.
Experience with basic programming language such as C++, Python, Java, etc. Data analytics, enhanced statistics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning knowledge beneficial.
Experience in initiating, developing, and executing R&D projects.
Relocation Options:
Relocationmay beconsidered.
International Considerations:
Expatriate assignmentsmay beconsidered.

Applicant must be able to use current US work authorization or able to apply for TN or E-3 Visa (no new visa applications in other cases)

title: Welcome Back Returnship Program - Financial Auditor
description:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job Description
 
  
   Chevron is accepting online applications for the position Financial Auditor located in Houston, TX or San Ramon, CA through May 30th, 2022 at 11:59 p.m. (Pacific Standard Time).
   
    Chevron is one of the world’s leading integrated energy companies and conducts business worldwide. Detailed information for the countries where Chevron’s work is most extensive can be found www.chevron.com/worldwide. Our success is driven by our people and their commitment to get results the right way-by operating responsibly, executing with excellence, applying innovative technologies, and capturing new opportunities for profitable growth. We are involved in virtually every facet of the energy industry. We explore for, produce and transport crude oil and natural gas; refine, market, and distribute transportation fuels and lubricants; manufacture and sell petrochemical products and generate power. Chevron is headquartered in San Ramon, California. More information about Chevron is available at www.chevron.com.
   
    The Welcome Back Returnship Program:
   
    Life happens, and sometimes we must make tough decisions. Many talented individuals consciously step away from their careers for reasons that may include starting or raising a family, caring for a family member, military service, or something else. Chevron’s Welcome Back Program is designed to support and develop experienced professionals when they make that next decision: to re-enter the workforce following a career hiatus.
   
    Welcome Back is a 12-week program with integrated learning that includes supervisor and mentor support, experiential learning, career support, and formal training as needed. Successful participants may be offered full-time employment at the end of their Returnship.
   
    Chevron offers a 9/80 work schedule and a hybrid work model; specific days in the office are flexible based on job requirements.
   
    Returners who convert to full time hires at the end of their programs will take advantage of these additional benefits once hired:
   
     Competitive base pay
     Annual incentive awards when the company meets its established goals
     Health and dental care coverage
     Retirement and savings plans
     Disability and life insurance
     Domestic partner benefits for same-sex or opposite-sex domestic partners
     Flexible Spending Account Plan
     Time off (paid vacations and holidays)
     Access to counseling services and treatment facilities through Employee Assistance and WorkLife Services and the Mental Health/Substance Abuse Plan
     Compressed workweek schedules and flextime options
     Programs to help you balance your work and personal schedule
     Adoption benefits
     Dependent care expense reimbursement for business travelers
     Fitness centers, fitness membership partnerships, and fitness incentive programs (varies by location)
     Recognition and service awards programs to recognize outstanding performance
   
   
    Chevron Financial Auditor 
   
   Chevron’s Corporate Audit organization helps Chevron's businesses and functions enhance and protect value by providing risk-based and objective assurance, advice, and insight. Performs audit testing and analysis for effectiveness of operating and financial process controls across a wide variety of audit subjects. Applies digital skills to synthesize and analyze large data sets to distill key findings. The role requires innovative and critical thinking in leveraging technology, project management skills, and recommending risk mitigation solutions. After first year, will be expected to lead audits of moderate complexity and mentor assisting auditors in audit tools and techniques. Performs advance planning for audits and consultations, identifying risks and resource needs. Facilitates meetings with diverse clients, including senior leaders, to explain the audit process, resolve complex audit issues, and reach agreement with findings presented in the audit report.
   
    Responsibilities for this this position may include but are not limited to:
   
     Evaluates effectiveness and efficiency of internal control, risk management, and governance processes across wide variety of business units, functions, and operations
     Demonstrates knowledge of business objectives, accounting and finance processes, inherent risks, and relevant controls
     Ability to apply knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles and auditing standards
     Effectively reveals financial and compliance exposures and highlights effective mitigation options
     Leverages risk assessment techniques such as impact and likelihood to differentiate risk levels
     Skilled at applying digital skills in analysis of large data sets to distill and communicate key findings
     Skilled at using data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI) to illustrate key findings and risks
     Facilitates meetings with diverse clients, including senior leaders, to explain the audit process, resolve complex audit issues, and confirm understanding of findings presented in the audit report
     Collaborates on audit team activities and exercises critical thinking and sound judgment in recommending scope changes to optimize value of each engagement
     Skilled at detecting and addressing potentially systemic issues and drawing simple conclusions and logical recommendations from complex or sensitive issues
     With experience, regularly performs Engagement Lead role on complex/sensitive audits with significant operations, compliance, and financial exposures
     With experience, performs Engagement Manager role on audits of moderate complexity
     Ability to engage with clients at all levels to establish trust, confidence in the team’s business knowledge and value of audit team recommendations
   
   
    Key Considerations:
   
     Positions are located in Houston, TX or at Chevron’s headquarters in San Ramon, CA
     Hybrid work model: two days in-office, three days remote. 9/80 work schedule supported
     Flexibility to travel domestically for on-site audit engagements
     Interest in future Chevron assignments as part of the broader Finance Function and/or embedded positions within Upstream, Midstream, Downstream and other support functions
   
   
    Chevron’s Finance organization looks for career-minded individuals with technical and leadership potential. The company has a strong emphasis on continuous learning and development - enabling their employees to have successful and challenging careers. We believe that you drive your career. The company rewards strong performance by providing accounting and finance professionals with advancement opportunities across the corporation.
   
    Required Qualifications:
   
     Currently on a career break of 18 months or longer
     Bachelor's or higher degree in Accounting, Finance or Business
     3+ years of relevant experience in Finance/Accounting/Audit
   
   
    Preferred Qualifications:
   
     Corporate Finance/Accounting, Public Accounting, Energy Industry or Advisory experience
     Experience with internal controls practices and compliance topics such as Sarbanes-Oxley testing
     Experience in leveraging emerging technologies to enhance business processes
     CPA and/or MBA considered a plus
   
   
    Preferred Skills:
   
     Analytical - Critical thinker with ability to quickly assimilate new information, understand key business processes, apply a risk-based mindset and approach, and develop and execute a thoughtful audit response. Strong understanding and application of risk and controls. Ability to efficiently mine and analyze large data sets to understand business and value drivers. Experienced at designing quantitative and qualitative analysis to draw conclusive and compelling insights
     Communication - Strong written and verbal communication skills - able to document work logically and produce formal reporting of results. Provide clear, persuasive recommendations to internal and external stakeholders. Able to synthesize complex topics and present in concise fashion targeted to the desired audience
     Leadership/Initiative - Effective at distilling organizational objectives into specific strategies or plans to achieve desired results. Demonstrated ability to articulate goals, champion issues and effectively engage, mobilize and influence organizations or teams. Demonstrated persistence in driving progress on key initiatives and consistently seeking to broaden the scope of role. Proactively drives continuous improvement and simplification. Able to effectively manage multiple tasks to completion under tight deadlines
     Teamwork/Interpersonal - Ability to work collaboratively in a multi-discipline team environment, across geographic boundaries, and with a wide range of stakeholders. Must be able to develop and maintain effective rapport and relationships with peers, other departments, and functions, and with relevant external partners and organizations. Track record of effectively delivering and receiving feedback
   
   
    Relocation Options:
    Relocation will not be considered.
    International Considerations:
    Expatriate assignments will not be considered. 
   
   Chevron regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited Visa status for this position.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breast-feeding and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin or ancestry, age, mental or physical disability (including medical condition), military or veteran status, political preference, marital status, citizenship, genetic information or other status protected by law or regulation.

   Job Description:
  
   We are looking for Software Engineers and Application Engineers to join Chevron IT. These professionals deliver innovative and functional solutions, driving them through design, planning, development, deployment, and support, that simplify business processes and workflows to drive business value. They use solid software development best practices and standard tools to ensure quality and maintainable digital solutions that include modularity, scalability, observability, and integration. They work on key projects and digital innovation initiatives following agile principals and collaborate with other product teams to develop and share reusable software components and services, and implement consistent automated builds including managing test coverage, build schedules, and build qualities. Scope of work includes:
  
    Web application development
    Foundational digital platforms and capabilities development
    Distributed computing
    System and security design and development
    Networking and data storage
    Automation technologies, artificial intelligence, and natural language processing
    UI / UX design
    Mobile application development and publication 
   APIs design and implementation across platforms and solutions
    Design and development using data engineering, data integration and data management practices and tools
  
  
   Software Engineering Responsibilities:
  
    Hands-on coding to deliver functional, innovative software solutions
    Utilize CI/CD tooling to deploy software and iterate on solutions
    Design and develop data integration and data management practices and tools for software solutions
    Maintain working knowledge of the latest software engineering tools and practices for continuous integration, unit tests, static and dynamic profiling, code coverage, code analysis, and automated tests
    Work on an agile team to prioritize and deliver business value.
  
  
   Application Engineering Responsibilities:
  
    Hands-on development for integrating existing solutions with larger enterprise ecosystem (e.g., API development, Azure Data Factory)
    Utilize CI/CD tooling to deploy software and iterate on solutions
    Design and develop data integration and data management practices and tools for software solutions
    Understand technical requirements to maintain & support vendor applications
    Work on an agile team to prioritize and deliver business value.
  
  
   Required Qualifications:
  
    Currently on a career break of 18 months or longer
    Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Management Information Systems, Electrical Engineering, Petroleum Engineering, or related fields or equivalent experience.
    3+ years of experience in Software or Application Engineering
    Experience building solutions in one of the following: C#, C++, Angular, Node.js, SQL, Ansible, R, Java, Python
    Strong familiarity with gitflow and source control management methodologies
    Knowledge of modern solution design methods (MVC, MVVM, SPA, etc.)
    Demonstrated experience with Software Development Lifecycle (plan, design, develop, test, release, maintain and support, decommission)
    Familiarity designing and implementing modern API’s, including how modern UI’s are built consuming services/API’s
    Demonstrated ability to solve complex problems & apply creative thinking to deliver technical solutions
    Strong written and verbal communication
    Demonstrated business negotiation skills, influence, conflict resolution, and resolving technical stalemates.
    Successful candidates will frequently work with global teams across time zones.
  
  
   Preferred Qualifications:
  
    Hands-on experience with Azure Cloud, Service Now, Ansible, and Azure DevOps
    Experience working on agile teams, utilizing industry methodologies such as SAFe, Scrum, Kanban etc.
    Ability to perform cost benefit analysis at a technical level
    Experience developing with low-code platforms (e.g., PowerApps) is a plus

title: Senior Application Analyst
description:
Chevron is accepting online applications for the position Senior Application Analyst through 05/31/2022 at 11:59 p.m. (Central Time)
Join our Team
Chevron’s strategy is straight-forward: be a leader in efficient and lower carbon production of traditional energy, in high demand today and for decades to come, while growing lower carbon businesses that will be a bigger part of the future. To achieve these goals, we’ll build on the assets, experience, capabilities, and relationships we’ve developed over 140 years to incubate and grow new business.
Technology will play a crucial role in unlocking ever cleaner and more affordable sources of energy. Chevron is seeking innovative, technology professionals with a desire to thrive in the global digital environment and help us lead the global energy transition.
An IT career at Chevron offers you the opportunity to work in a technical environment with a global reach. You’ll find that we make a business of investing in our people and encouraging your professional development through a learning culture and challenging on-the-job opportunities. We differentiate ourselves through the application of cutting-edge technology, and by taking a collaborative approach that includes in-house expertise, proprietary solutions, and strategic partnerships. We also offer flexible work schedules and very competitive benefits.
Join Chevron IT. Lend us your skills and enjoy a great career with Chevron.
Multiple positions available, based on domain experience and technical capabilities.

title: Sr. Financial Services Representative
description:
Job detailsSalary$40,320 - $55,440 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job Description
 
 
  Chevron Federal Credit Union is one of the top-run credit unions in the country – and one of the largest, with $4 billion in assets. Yet our corporate culture is not stuffy: the Team Spirit Committee runs fun activities and charitable events throughout the year, and work-life balance, mutual respect, diversity, and providing a voice for every employee are all important to us. As you might imagine, we provide competitive pay and great benefits, including:
  
    Bonus/incentives for all regular employees
    401(k) with 8% company contribution
    Medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees and dependents paid at 80%
    PTO and paid sabbaticals
    Tuition reimbursement
  
   Pay Range: $40,320 - $55,440
   GENERAL SUMMARY: Accurately perform branch functions while providing a high level of personal service as described below. Identify member needs and provide information and assistance in meeting them. Knowledgeably assist members with their consumer lending needs. Adhere to both individual and branch sales goals as assigned.
   Member Service Responsibilities
  
    Perform general and vault teller functions such as: receiving and cashing checks and cash for deposits, examining checks for endorsements, accepting and processing loan payments, cashing checks, and paying out money.
    Keep records of money and negotiable instruments involved in financial transactions, entering transactions into computer.
    Balance currency, coin, and checks.
    Process non-monetary mail transactions including deposit verifications, address changes, check orders, statement questions, requests for copies, etc.
    Process membership applications and collect initial deposits.
    As needed, remove deposits, count and balance, and replenish cash in automated teller machines and express drop boxes.
    Identify member needs by reviewing account data and promote new and additional products and services to enhance members’ financial satisfaction. Complete a member profile questionnaire during member interactions.
    Identify sales prospects and follow up on leads in order to adhere to both individual and branch sales targets as assigned.
    Participate in Business Development events and actively solicit new memberships and promote additional products and services to existing members.
    Provide information on all Credit Union services, counsel members and prospective members in person or by phone on membership requirements, and provide information on all savings and consumer loan products.
  
   Lending Responsibilities
  
    Recognize and identify member’s deposit and loan needs demonstrating through understanding of all consumer loan products.
    Interview loan applicants to obtain personal and financial date and review loan applications for completeness.
    Accurately enter information in loan systems.
    Review and evaluate the member’s credit report. Make recommendations to loan officers to approve or deny loan requests based on automated loan systems results.
    Assist in the loan funding process by following Direct Lending Center procedures.
  
   Assume a lead role within the branch:
  
    Assist in managing the branch within authorized authority, and in accordance with practices as set out in policy and procedures.
    Handle more complex member service functions.
    Assist Branch Manager with Branch Monthly Audits and review branch reports as assigned.
  
   Promote Credit Union-sponsored business and lending functions. In Manager’s absence, assume Manager’s responsibilities by coaching, mentoring and leading other employees.
   QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:
   To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
   EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: 
  
   Two-year certificate from college or technical school, plus two to three years’ related experience and/or training. Equivalent combination of education and experience may substitute for stated qualifications.
  
   SKILLS:
  
    Ability to speak clearly, tactfully, and effectively to members, volunteers, and employees at all levels of organization.
    Additional for Sr. FSR: Ability to read and interpret documents such as loan agreements and debt obligation documents such as judgments, liens, maintenance enforcement orders and similar instructions and processes related to debt obligations and recovery procedures.
    Ability to compute rates, ratios, and percentages.
    Ability to effectively use all applicable banking and loan systems.
    Moderate keyboard skills at 40 wpm and 10-key by touch.
  
   OTHER:
  
    Employee must be flexible, a self starter, highly motivated and able to work independently.
    Ability to work effectively with members and employees at all levels in the organization
    Ability to maintain complete confidentiality of member, employee, and Credit Union information.
    Accurate and efficient cash handling skills
    Detail orientation and accuracy
    Excellent customer service skills
    Ability to become a Notary Public
  
   PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
   The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  
    Work routinely involves sitting or standing for up to eight hours per day.
    Work involves extensive use of computers, up to eight hours per day.
    May include occasional pushing, pulling, or carrying objects weighing up to 20 pounds such as files and documents.
    Must be able to speak on the telephone for several hours per day.
    Requires close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus.
  
   We welcome all qualified applicants and pride ourselves on our diversity. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the position.

title: Advertising Advisor
description:
Chevron is one of the world’s leading integrated energy companies. We believe affordable, reliable and ever-cleaner energy is essential to achieving a more prosperous and sustainable world. Chevron produces crude oil and natural gas; manufactures transportation fuels, lubricants, petrochemicals and additives; and develops technologies that enhance our business and industry. We are focused on lowering the carbon intensity in our operations and seeking to grow lower carbon businesses along with our traditional business lines.
Chevron brings together some of the best and brightest experienced professionals in the industry, and then gives them opportunity to grow. Turn your ideas into solutions. We offer a truly global and collaborative work experience.
Join our Team
Corporate Affairs proactively manages social, political, and reputational risks for Chevron and engages the workforce to advance the business. We strengthen Chevron's strategic advocacy, communications, and social investments to build confidence in our company and industry.
Chevron’s strategy is straight-forward: be a leader in efficient and lower carbon production of traditional energy, in high demand today and for decades to come, while growing lower carbon businesses that will be a bigger part of the future. To achieve these goals, we’ll build on the assets, experience, capabilities, and relationships we’ve developed over 140 years to incubate and grow new business.
As an Advertising Advisor you will:
Assist with the daily management and execution of Chevron’s corporate and local advertising campaigns and communications.
Oversee planning and execution of paid media for TV, print, radio, social, search, newsletters, podcasts, etc.
Develop creative and/or paid media briefs and supports strategic message development, creative content development, production activities, brand and competitive paid media tracking, measurement and reporting.
Track approvals, legal review and substantiation of advertising claims, and media-production estimates, budgets and timelines.
Manage agency partners across multiple agencies and disciplines.
Provide consultation to key internal business partners and local lines of business on advertising communications and opportunities best suited for their stakeholder engagement needs.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree
3-5 years’ direct advertising and marketing experience
Demonstrated ability to translate business needs into creative and media briefs.
Experience in providing guidance to agency partners to develop and execute creative concepts and content (i.e., TV, print, radio, social, digital, OOH).
Proven experience with and knowledge of paid media channels and planning (omni-channel marketing, audience targeting, content placement, reporting-metrics, campaign optimization).
Demonstrated ability to manage and track integrated plans, deliverables and budgets to ensure on-time and on-budget quality delivery of campaigns.
Experience with tools to support content ideation, collaboration and measurement (e.g., Sprinklr, Opal, Domo, native platform insights), as well as conducting research, brand tracking studies, social listening and sentiment analysis (via Brandwatch, Sysomos, Crimson-Hexagon, third-party tracking studies, etc.).
Preferred Qualifications:
Communications, PR, Marketing, or related degree
Strong project management skills
Digital curiosity and a desire for continuous learning about emerging media and marketing opportunities
Advertising agency experience or B2B/corporate advertising on the “client side”; ability to navigate a large, matrixed organization
Relocation Options:
Relocation may be considered.
International Considerations:
Expatriate assignment will not be considered.
Chevron regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited Visa status for this position.
Flexible Working, Work-Life Balance, Hybrid Schedules
Chevron offers a complete package and provides career development opportunities to all employees. We do this through onboarding, training and development, mentoring, volunteering opportunities and employee networking groups. We advocate work-life balance and offer employees access to various health and wellness programs. We also offer hybrid work models and alternative work schedules.
Working with us
At Chevron we approach challenges with integrity, ingenuity, and respect. By valuing our employees, our partners, and our world, we’ve created a company that’s responsively moving the world forward. We value a full spectrum of human experience: diversity of thought, education, national origin, gender, skills, and experiences. We firmly believe that by pooling our unique talents and perspectives, and by inspiring each other, we will define the future of energy.
Benefits
Chevron offers competitive compensation and benefits programs, including variable pay, healthcare coverage, retirement plan, insurance, time off programs, training and development opportunities and a range of allowances connected to specific work situations. Details of such benefits and allowances are available at https://hr2.chevron.com/. The selected candidate’s salary will be determined based on his or her skills, experience, and qualifications.

title: Welcome Back Returnship Program – Scrum Master
description:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job Description
 
  
   Chevron is one of the world’s leading integrated energy companies and conducts business worldwide. Detailed information for the countries where Chevron’s work is most extensive can be found www.chevron.com/worldwide. Our success is driven by our people and their commitment to get results the right way-by operating responsibly, executing with excellence, applying innovative technologies, and capturing new opportunities for profitable growth. We are involved in virtually every facet of the energy industry. We explore for, produce and transport crude oil and natural gas; refine, market, and distribute transportation fuels and lubricants; manufacture and sell petrochemical products and generate power. Chevron is headquartered in San Ramon, California. More information about Chevron is available at www.chevron.com.
   
    Chevron believes the future of energy is lower carbon. And we know that affordable, reliable, ever-cleaner energy is essential to achieving a more prosperous and sustainable world. For Chevron, reducing the carbon intensity of oil and gas represents a tremendous opportunity to advance the global net zero ambitions of the Paris Agreement and build a lower-carbon economy.
   
    Technology will play a crucial role in achieving this goal, and Chevron is seeking professionals with a desire to thrive in a cutting-edge digital, global environment to securely advance the global energy transition. We differentiate ourselves through the application of technology, taking an approach that includes in-house expertise, proprietary solutions, and strategic partnerships.
   
    The Welcome Back Returnship Program:
   
    Life happens, and sometimes we must make tough decisions. Many talented individuals consciously step away from their careers for reasons that may include starting or raising a family, caring for a family member, military service, or something else. Chevron’s Welcome Back Program is designed to support and develop experienced professionals when they make that next decision: to re-enter the workforce following a career hiatus.
   
    Welcome Back is a 12-week program with integrated learning that includes supervisor and mentor support, experiential learning, career support, and formal training as needed. Successful participants may be offered full-time employment at the end of their returnship.
   
    Chevron offers a 9/80 work schedule and a hybrid work model; specific days in the office are flexible based on job requirements.
   
    Returners who convert to full time hires at the end of their programs will take advantage of these additional benefits once hired:
   
     Competitive base pay
     Annual incentive awards when the company meets its established goals
     Health and dental care coverage
     Retirement and savings plans
     Disability and life insurance
     Domestic partner benefits for same-sex or opposite-sex domestic partners
     Flexible Spending Account Plan
     Time off (paid vacations and holidays)
     Access to counseling services and treatment facilities through Employee Assistance and WorkLife Services and the Mental Health/Substance Abuse Plan
     Compressed workweek schedules and flextime options
     Programs to help you balance your work and personal schedule
     Adoption benefits
     Dependent care expense reimbursement for business travelers
     Fitness centers, fitness membership partnerships, and fitness incentive programs (varies by location)
     Recognition and service awards programs to recognize outstanding performance
   
   
    Job Description:
   
    We seek passionate individuals who exemplify high performing behaviors and share our vision of bringing Agile/Scrum and the power of new ways of working and solutions to IT and internal business partners. The Scrum Master facilitates and champions the agile software development process by coaching and mentoring development teams, identifying and eliminating impediments, and promoting the use of established standards and novel practices. Scrum Master is a servant leader of the team and coaches the team on self-organization.
   
    Responsibilities:
   
     Facilitate and champion the agile methodology by coaching and mentoring development teams and promoting the use of standards and best practices.
     Coach the team to improve collaboration and self-management, promoting healthy interactions both within the team and with external stakeholders.
     Facilitates the identification and removal of impediments to the team’s progress and focus on eliminating waste and delays.
     As a servant leader, promotes adoption of an agile mindset through teaching, mentoring, and coaching.
     Ensures the team is utilizing Scrum/SAFe ceremonies effectively to maximize value delivery and facilitates Scrum ceremonies.
     Represent the team at broader planning and coordination sessions (e.g., Scrum of Scrums).
     Actively participate in learning opportunities such as communities of practice or conferences to improve skills and better support the team.
     Contribute to the advancement and improvement of agile practices within the organization.
   
   
    Required Qualifications:
   
     Currently on a career break of 18 months or longer
     Bachelor’s degree in an IT or business-related discipline
     3+ years of experience with agile development
     1-2+ years of Scrum Master experience managing distributed agile teams
     Experience creating Azure Dev Ops queries, dashboards, and boards
     Experience with SAFe framework preferred but not required
     Deep knowledge of agile practices, frameworks, and techniques
     Coaching skills and ability to motivate teams
     Strong communication and facilitation skills
     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
     Experience with agile planning and development tools (e.g., Microsoft Azure DevOps).
   
   
    Preferred Qualifications:
   
     Master’s degree preferred
     Scrum Master certification(s)
     SAFe certification(s)
   
   
    Relocation Options:
    Relocation will not be considered.
    International Considerations:
    Expatriate assignments will not be considered. Chevron regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited Visa status for this position.
    Regulatory Disclosure for US Positions:
   
    Chevron is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breast-feeding and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin or ancestry, age, mental or physical disability (including medical condition), military or veteran status, political preference, marital status, citizenship, genetic information or other status protected by law or regulation.
   
    We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please email us at emplymnt@chevron.com.
   
    Chevron participates in E-Verify in certain locations as required by law.

    Mechanical Engineer Overview: 
   
   We are looking for a Mechanical Engineer to join Chevron Technology Center in Houston, TX to provide consultation to Business Units, Complex Process Facility sites, and Major Capital Projects. This employee will support the Chevron Technical Center Asset Performance and Process Safety (APPS) organization in their equipment monitoring and facility support efforts.      Receives and acts on feedback from customers; history of giving feedback to others
     Demonstrated ability to mentor developing engineers and focus on developing own knowledge base
     Experience where digital/high-value tools were used to impact business results or lower carbon
     Develops creative solutions to overcome barriers for self and others
     Demonstrated ability to manage diverse workload for multiple customers and be willing to support domestic and international operating facilities with occasional multi-week technical consulting roles.
     History of concisely and credibly communicating (orally and in writing) effectively with customers, peers, and leadership to achieve results.

     Equipment knowledge base needed can include rotating equipment (pumps, gas & steam turbines, centrifugal and positive displacement compressors) and/or fixed equipment (tanks, piping, valves, pressure vessels, heat exchangers).

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Chevron is accepting online applications for the position Business Intelligence Analyst through 5/13/2022 at 11:59 p.m. (Central Time)
Join our Team
Chevron’s strategy is straight-forward: be a leader in efficient and lower carbon production of traditional energy, in high demand today and for decades to come, while growing lower carbon businesses that will be a bigger part of the future. To achieve these goals, we’ll build on the assets, experience, capabilities, and relationships we’ve developed over 140 years to incubate and grow new business.
Technology will play a crucial role in unlocking ever cleaner and more affordable sources of energy. Chevron is seeking innovative, technology professionals with a desire to thrive in the global digital environment and help us lead the global energy transition.
An IT career at Chevron offers you the opportunity to work in a technical environment with a global reach. You’ll find that we make a business of investing in our people and encouraging your professional development through a learning culture and challenging on-the-job opportunities. We differentiate ourselves through the application of cutting-edge technology, and by taking a collaborative approach that includes in-house expertise, proprietary solutions, and strategic partnerships. We also offer flexible work schedules and very competitive benefits.
Join Chevron IT. Lend us your skills and enjoy a great career with Chevron.
Chevron's Business Intelligence Analyst is accountable for understanding data in the larger context of the business and the value chain to transform data into insights for better decision-making through scientific exploration, analytics, and data. The BI Analyst is responsible for leading data analytics initiatives within Chevron business by performing data analysis, translating data requirements to technical requirements, and driving insights to business problems and decisions.
Responsibilities for this position may include but are not limited to:
Work closely with the product owner and business stakeholders as a member of agile team
Have an in-depth understanding of business problem in hand
Access, gather, and analyze data from source systems
Help frame the business problem by providing quantitative and qualitative data analysis (data quality, availability, etc.)
Drive insights to business problems by visualizing the data and telling a story through data (report patterns, trends, anomalies, etc.)
Contribute to data analysis, data wrangling, data visualization, and user acceptance testing
Present findings and new development to help refine backlog items
Required Qualifications:
Minimum 5 years of experience in data visualization
Experience working with various data sources and connections
Experience in data modeling and understanding of data architecture
Familiar with data visualization tool (Microsoft Power BI, TIBCO Spotfire)
Data modeling (such as Azure Analysis Services)
Data wrangling tools and language (Python, Databricks, for example)
Preferred Education
B.S. or M.S. in Business Analytics, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Mathematics or Engineering
Relocation Options:
Relocation may be considered.
International Considerations:
Expatriate assignments will not be considered.
Chevron regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited Visa status for this position.
Flexible Working
Chevron offers a complete package and provides career development opportunities to all employees. We do this through onboarding, training and development, mentoring, volunteering opportunities and employee networking groups. We advocate work-life balance and offer employees access to various health and wellness programs.
We offer a hybrid work model - work remotely from home 2-3 days a week
Working with us
Chevron is one of the world’s leading integrated energy companies. We believe affordable, reliable, and ever-cleaner energy is essential to achieving a more prosperous and sustainable world. Chevron produces crude oil and natural gas; manufactures transportation fuels, lubricants, petrochemicals, and additives; and develops technologies that enhance our business and the industry. We are focused on lowering the carbon intensity in our operations and seeking to grow lower carbon businesses along with our traditional business lines. More information about Chevron is available at www.chevron.com.
Benefits
Chevron offers competitive compensation and benefits programs which includes, but is not limited to, variable pay, healthcare coverage, retirement plan, insurance, time off programs, training and development opportunities and a range of allowances connected to specific work situations. Details of such benefits and allowances are available at https://hr2.chevron.com/.
The compensation and reference to benefits for this role is listed on this posting in compliance with Colorado law. The selected candidate’s salary will be determined based on his or her skills, experience, and qualifications.

title: Seal Quality Specialist
description:

The role requires that the successful candidate deliver business impact and develop differentiated Seal Quality technologies, workflows, and services with a focus on the structural aspects of exploration-scale seal and trap issues and compartmentalization.

title: Lead Legal Assistant
description:
Job detailsSalary$76,000 - $78,000 a yearFull Job Description
 
  
   Chevron is accepting online applications for the position of Legal Administrative Assistant located in Houston, TX through May 11th, 2022 at 11:59 p.m.
   
    This position supports ten (12) Chevron lawyers, who manage Chevron’s major transactions. This group is comprised of lawyers who handle U.S and international matters across the value chain. The international team travels internationally and must attend calls and virtual meetings across a variety of time zones. The individual will report to the Manager of Legal Services, Upstream.
   
    The salary range for this position is between $76,000 - $78,000 a year plus competitive benefits and bonus.
   
    This position requires a high level of initiative, accuracy, and attention to detail. This position also requires an individual who has a positive, can-do attitude, strong interpersonal skills, excellent problem-solving skills, is proactive, has demonstrated the ability to multitask and manage high volume of work and works well independently as well as in teams. The position works closely with other Chevron law groups outside of the U.S. and outside legal organizations.
   
    Responsibilities for this position may include but are not limited to:
   
    
      Drafting, formatting, and revising legal documents under stringent deadlines which require strong word processing skills, attention to detail and excellent proofreading skills to assure accuracy and coherency.
     Fluency with FCC Format and Style Guidelines
     Using Microsoft Word track-change function and Workshare Professional to edit and revise documents.
     Assisting the lawyers in preparing correspondence, presentations, and routine reports.
     Coordinates logistics, agendas, and presentation materials, for meetings, conference, and special functions.
     Coordinating international and domestic travel logistics.
     Tracking and coordinating all travel requirements including, visas, immunizations, photos, passport
     renewals, etc.
     
    
     Preparing detailed itineraries.
     Tracking and gathering related expenses and compiling complicated expense reports in expense reporting system (CTREX).
     Creating and updating legal matters in internal matter management system (Team Connect).
     Handling and processing e-billings, invoices, and payments within and outside the legal software system, Team Connect. Sets up vendors in internal vendor system.
     Working in iManage uploading materials, calendaring, reviewing, and researching documents and
     generating reports.
     
    
     Following through to ensure deadlines are met.
     Assigning action items as needed and follows up for completion.
     Researching inquiries and relieving leaders of administrative details.
     Acting as an information resource in the area of computer systems support software and hardware technical support.
     Assisting and providing backup coverage to other legal assistants.
    
   
   
    Required Qualifications:
   
    
      Associates degree or Administrative assistant certification or equivalent.
     5+ years Legal administrative experience supporting transactional attorneys
     Proficiency in SharePoint, iManage and MS office applications: Outlook, Forms, Word (Advanced Features), PowerPoint, Team Connect, CTREX.
     Proficiency in MS Teams.
     Basic to intermediate skills in Excel.
     Basic skills in DocuSign.
     Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
     Basic computer technical skills
    
   
    Preferred Qualifications:
   
    
      Bachelor's degree
     Experience in and/or working relationship with the Chevron Law Function
     Experience with e-billing, matter management systems and setting up vendors in payment system.
     Notary
     Demonstrated high level of initiative and independence.
     Demonstrated strong interpersonal skills.
     Demonstrated ability to adapt readily to the needs of diverse work groups and remain calm under
     Pressure.
     
    
     Must possess the ability to maintain the upmost confidentiality and adapt to changing needs and
     deadlines.
     
    
     Ability to effectively communicate (oral and written) at all levels of the organization.
     Demonstrated ability to take initiative, prioritize and meet deadlines.
     Ability to multi-task, anticipate needs and requirements, and follow through on commitments.
     Ability to problem solve and use good judgement in making sound decisions quickly.
    
   
   
    Relocation Options:
    Relocation will not be considered.
   
    International Considerations:
    Expatriate assignments will not be considered.

title: Reservoir Engineer
description:
Chevron is accepting online applications for the position Reservoir Engineer through May 10th, 2022 at 11:59 p.m. (CDT).

Responsibilities for this position may include but are not limited to:
Responsible for Recovery Mechanisms/Mechanistic Modeling Research & Development for Conventional/Unconventional Reservoirs with focus on Surfactant-Gas EOR.
Position builds functional excellence in recovery mechanisms & mechanistic modeling in surfactant-gas EOR in conventional and unconventional reservoirs. Along with group lead, ensures Chevron’s leading position in first principles reservoir engineering and understanding of producing mechanisms with focus on surfactant-gas options related to gas EOR/cyclic gas injection in conventional and unconventional reservoirs. Responsibilities include strong teaming with Chevron subsurface subject matter experts and Schlumberger to incorporate mechanistic models into the IX simulator. Will work closely with the Chevron Technical Center’s labs and help guide first principles research and/or experiments that drive resource to reserves to production to financial returns. Will develop conceptual models, micro-models, mechanistic sim., etc. Will team with the subsurface data platform-digital organization in data analytics (ML, AI, etc.). Will direct work with vendors, academic research, and national labs. Will assist with teaming, functional excellence and organizational capability development.
Required Qualifications:
PhD in Chemical or Petroleum Engineering
Experience in surfactant/surfactant-gas EOR R&D in with an emphasis on complex mechanisms, e.g., surfactant structure property modeling relating EOR performance to surfactant formulation.
Preferred Qualifications:
Working knowledge of hydrocarbon recovery concepts and applications.
Solid background in conceptual models, molecular simulation, micro-models, and mechanistic simulation and reservoir simulation.
Experience working in labs or closely with labs and guiding first principles research and/or experiments that drive the understanding of surfactant/surfactant-gas EOR.
Experience with basic programming language such as C++, Python, Java, etc. Data analytics, enhanced statistics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning knowledge beneficial.
Experience in initiating, developing, and executing R&D projects.

Relocationmay beconsidered.
International Considerations:
Expatriate assignmentsmay beconsidered.
US visa verbiage for US positions (expat eligible and domestic in consideration of GOPs)
Applicant must be able to use current US work authorization or able to apply for TN or E-3 Visa (no new visa applications in other cases)

title: Welcome Back Returnship Program - Financial Auditor
description:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job Description
 
  
   Chevron is accepting online applications for the position Financial Auditor located in Houston, TX or San Ramon, CA through May 30th, 2022 at 11:59 p.m. (Pacific Standard Time).
   
    Chevron is one of the world’s leading integrated energy companies and conducts business worldwide. Detailed information for the countries where Chevron’s work is most extensive can be found www.chevron.com/worldwide. Our success is driven by our people and their commitment to get results the right way-by operating responsibly, executing with excellence, applying innovative technologies, and capturing new opportunities for profitable growth. We are involved in virtually every facet of the energy industry. We explore for, produce and transport crude oil and natural gas; refine, market, and distribute transportation fuels and lubricants; manufacture and sell petrochemical products and generate power. Chevron is headquartered in San Ramon, California. More information about Chevron is available at www.chevron.com.
   
    The Welcome Back Returnship Program:
   
    Life happens, and sometimes we must make tough decisions. Many talented individuals consciously step away from their careers for reasons that may include starting or raising a family, caring for a family member, military service, or something else. Chevron’s Welcome Back Program is designed to support and develop experienced professionals when they make that next decision: to re-enter the workforce following a career hiatus.
   
    Welcome Back is a 12-week program with integrated learning that includes supervisor and mentor support, experiential learning, career support, and formal training as needed. Successful participants may be offered full-time employment at the end of their Returnship.
   
    Chevron offers a 9/80 work schedule and a hybrid work model; specific days in the office are flexible based on job requirements.
   
    Returners who convert to full time hires at the end of their programs will take advantage of these additional benefits once hired:
   
     Competitive base pay
     Annual incentive awards when the company meets its established goals
     Health and dental care coverage
     Retirement and savings plans
     Disability and life insurance
     Domestic partner benefits for same-sex or opposite-sex domestic partners
     Flexible Spending Account Plan
     Time off (paid vacations and holidays)
     Access to counseling services and treatment facilities through Employee Assistance and WorkLife Services and the Mental Health/Substance Abuse Plan
     Compressed workweek schedules and flextime options
     Programs to help you balance your work and personal schedule
     Adoption benefits
     Dependent care expense reimbursement for business travelers
     Fitness centers, fitness membership partnerships, and fitness incentive programs (varies by location)
     Recognition and service awards programs to recognize outstanding performance
   
   
    Chevron Financial Auditor 
   
   Chevron’s Corporate Audit organization helps Chevron's businesses and functions enhance and protect value by providing risk-based and objective assurance, advice, and insight. Performs audit testing and analysis for effectiveness of operating and financial process controls across a wide variety of audit subjects. Applies digital skills to synthesize and analyze large data sets to distill key findings. The role requires innovative and critical thinking in leveraging technology, project management skills, and recommending risk mitigation solutions. After first year, will be expected to lead audits of moderate complexity and mentor assisting auditors in audit tools and techniques. Performs advance planning for audits and consultations, identifying risks and resource needs. Facilitates meetings with diverse clients, including senior leaders, to explain the audit process, resolve complex audit issues, and reach agreement with findings presented in the audit report.
   
    Responsibilities for this this position may include but are not limited to:
   
     Evaluates effectiveness and efficiency of internal control, risk management, and governance processes across wide variety of business units, functions, and operations
     Demonstrates knowledge of business objectives, accounting and finance processes, inherent risks, and relevant controls
     Ability to apply knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles and auditing standards
     Effectively reveals financial and compliance exposures and highlights effective mitigation options
     Leverages risk assessment techniques such as impact and likelihood to differentiate risk levels
     Skilled at applying digital skills in analysis of large data sets to distill and communicate key findings
     Skilled at using data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI) to illustrate key findings and risks
     Facilitates meetings with diverse clients, including senior leaders, to explain the audit process, resolve complex audit issues, and confirm understanding of findings presented in the audit report
     Collaborates on audit team activities and exercises critical thinking and sound judgment in recommending scope changes to optimize value of each engagement
     Skilled at detecting and addressing potentially systemic issues and drawing simple conclusions and logical recommendations from complex or sensitive issues
     With experience, regularly performs Engagement Lead role on complex/sensitive audits with significant operations, compliance, and financial exposures
     With experience, performs Engagement Manager role on audits of moderate complexity
     Ability to engage with clients at all levels to establish trust, confidence in the team’s business knowledge and value of audit team recommendations
   
   
    Key Considerations:
   
     Positions are located in Houston, TX or at Chevron’s headquarters in San Ramon, CA
     Hybrid work model: two days in-office, three days remote. 9/80 work schedule supported
     Flexibility to travel domestically for on-site audit engagements
     Interest in future Chevron assignments as part of the broader Finance Function and/or embedded positions within Upstream, Midstream, Downstream and other support functions
   
   
    Chevron’s Finance organization looks for career-minded individuals with technical and leadership potential. The company has a strong emphasis on continuous learning and development - enabling their employees to have successful and challenging careers. We believe that you drive your career. The company rewards strong performance by providing accounting and finance professionals with advancement opportunities across the corporation.
   
    Required Qualifications:
   
     Currently on a career break of 18 months or longer
     Bachelor's or higher degree in Accounting, Finance or Business
     3+ years of relevant experience in Finance/Accounting/Audit
   
   
    Preferred Qualifications:
   
     Corporate Finance/Accounting, Public Accounting, Energy Industry or Advisory experience
     Experience with internal controls practices and compliance topics such as Sarbanes-Oxley testing
     Experience in leveraging emerging technologies to enhance business processes
     CPA and/or MBA considered a plus
   
   
    Preferred Skills:
   
     Analytical - Critical thinker with ability to quickly assimilate new information, understand key business processes, apply a risk-based mindset and approach, and develop and execute a thoughtful audit response. Strong understanding and application of risk and controls. Ability to efficiently mine and analyze large data sets to understand business and value drivers. Experienced at designing quantitative and qualitative analysis to draw conclusive and compelling insights
     Communication - Strong written and verbal communication skills - able to document work logically and produce formal reporting of results. Provide clear, persuasive recommendations to internal and external stakeholders. Able to synthesize complex topics and present in concise fashion targeted to the desired audience
     Leadership/Initiative - Effective at distilling organizational objectives into specific strategies or plans to achieve desired results. Demonstrated ability to articulate goals, champion issues and effectively engage, mobilize and influence organizations or teams. Demonstrated persistence in driving progress on key initiatives and consistently seeking to broaden the scope of role. Proactively drives continuous improvement and simplification. Able to effectively manage multiple tasks to completion under tight deadlines
     Teamwork/Interpersonal - Ability to work collaboratively in a multi-discipline team environment, across geographic boundaries, and with a wide range of stakeholders. Must be able to develop and maintain effective rapport and relationships with peers, other departments, and functions, and with relevant external partners and organizations. Track record of effectively delivering and receiving feedback
   
   
    Relocation Options:
    Relocation will not be considered.
    International Considerations:
    Expatriate assignments will not be considered. 
   
   Chevron regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited Visa status for this position.
    Regulatory Disclosure for US Positions:

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breast-feeding and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin or ancestry, age, mental or physical disability (including medical condition), military or veteran status, political preference, marital status, citizenship, genetic information or other status protected by law or regulation.

We are involved in virtually every facet of the energy industry. We explore for, produce and transport crude oil and natural gas; refine, market, and distribute transportation fuels and lubricants; manufacture and sell petrochemical products and generate power. Chevron is headquartered in San Ramon, California. More information about Chevron is available at www.chevron.com.
  
   Chevron believes the future of energy is lower carbon. And we know that affordable, reliable, ever-cleaner energy is essential to achieving a more prosperous and sustainable world. For Chevron, reducing the carbon intensity of oil and gas represents a tremendous opportunity to advance the global net zero ambitions of the Paris Agreement and build a lower-carbon economy.
  
   Technology will play a crucial role in achieving this goal, and Chevron is seeking professionals with a desire to thrive in a cutting-edge digital, global environment to securely advance the global energy transition. We differentiate ourselves through the application of technology, taking an approach that includes in-house expertise, proprietary solutions, and strategic partnerships.
  
   The Welcome Back Returnship Program:
  
   Life happens, and sometimes we must make tough decisions. Many talented individuals consciously step away from their careers for reasons that may include starting or raising a family, caring for a family member, military service, or something else. Chevron’s Welcome Back Program is designed to support and develop experienced professionals when they make that next decision: to re-enter the workforce following a career hiatus.
  
   Welcome Back is a 12-week program with integrated learning that includes supervisor and mentor support, experiential learning, career support, and formal training as needed. Successful participants may be offered full-time employment at the end of their returnship.
  
   Chevron offers a 9/80 work schedule and a hybrid work model; specific days in the office are flexible based on job requirements.
  
   Returners who convert to full time hires at the end of their programs will take advantage of these additional benefits once hired:
  
    Competitive base pay
    Annual incentive awards when the company meets its established goals
    Health and dental care coverage
    Retirement and savings plans
    Disability and life insurance
    Domestic partner benefits for same-sex or opposite-sex domestic partners
    Flexible Spending Account Plan
    Time off (paid vacations and holidays)
    Access to counseling services and treatment facilities through Employee Assistance and WorkLife Services and the Mental Health/Substance Abuse Plan
    Compressed workweek schedules and flextime options
    Programs to help you balance your work and personal schedule
    Adoption benefits
    Dependent care expense reimbursement for business travelers
    Fitness centers, fitness membership partnerships, and fitness incentive programs (varies by location)
    Recognition and service awards programs to recognize outstanding performance
  
  
   Job Description:
  
   We are looking for Software Engineers and Application Engineers to join Chevron IT. These professionals deliver innovative and functional solutions, driving them through design, planning, development, deployment, and support, that simplify business processes and workflows to drive business value. They use solid software development best practices and standard tools to ensure quality and maintainable digital solutions that include modularity, scalability, observability, and integration. They work on key projects and digital innovation initiatives following agile principals and collaborate with other product teams to develop and share reusable software components and services, and implement consistent automated builds including managing test coverage, build schedules, and build qualities. Scope of work includes:
  
    Web application development
    Foundational digital platforms and capabilities development
    Distributed computing
    System and security design and development
    Networking and data storage
    Automation technologies, artificial intelligence, and natural language processing
    UI / UX design
    Mobile application development and publication 
   APIs design and implementation across platforms and solutions
    Design and development using data engineering, data integration and data management practices and tools
  
  
   Software Engineering Responsibilities:
  
    Hands-on coding to deliver functional, innovative software solutions
    Utilize CI/CD tooling to deploy software and iterate on solutions
    Design and develop data integration and data management practices and tools for software solutions
    Maintain working knowledge of the latest software engineering tools and practices for continuous integration, unit tests, static and dynamic profiling, code coverage, code analysis, and automated tests
    Work on an agile team to prioritize and deliver business value.
  
  
   Application Engineering Responsibilities:
  
    Hands-on development for integrating existing solutions with larger enterprise ecosystem (e.g., API development, Azure Data Factory)
    Utilize CI/CD tooling to deploy software and iterate on solutions
    Design and develop data integration and data management practices and tools for software solutions
    Understand technical requirements to maintain & support vendor applications
    Work on an agile team to prioritize and deliver business value.
  
  
   Required Qualifications:
  
    Currently on a career break of 18 months or longer
    Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Management Information Systems, Electrical Engineering, Petroleum Engineering, or related fields or equivalent experience.
    3+ years of experience in Software or Application Engineering
    Experience building solutions in one of the following: C#, C++, Angular, Node.js, SQL, Ansible, R, Java, Python
    Strong familiarity with gitflow and source control management methodologies
    Knowledge of modern solution design methods (MVC, MVVM, SPA, etc.)
    Demonstrated experience with Software Development Lifecycle (plan, design, develop, test, release, maintain and support, decommission)
    Familiarity designing and implementing modern API’s, including how modern UI’s are built consuming services/API’s
    Demonstrated ability to solve complex problems & apply creative thinking to deliver technical solutions
    Strong written and verbal communication
    Demonstrated business negotiation skills, influence, conflict resolution, and resolving technical stalemates.
    Successful candidates will frequently work with global teams across time zones.
  
  
   Preferred Qualifications:
  
    Hands-on experience with Azure Cloud, Service Now, Ansible, and Azure DevOps
    Experience working on agile teams, utilizing industry methodologies such as SAFe, Scrum, Kanban etc.
    Ability to perform cost benefit analysis at a technical level
    Experience developing with low-code platforms (e.g., PowerApps) is a plus
  
  
   Relocation Options:
   Relocation will not be considered.
   International Considerations:
   Expatriate assignments will not be considered. Chevron regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited Visa status for this position.

   We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please email us at emplymnt@chevron.com.

title: Senior Application Analyst
description:
Chevron is accepting online applications for the position Senior Application Analyst through 05/31/2022 at 11:59 p.m. (Central Time)
Join our Team
Chevron’s strategy is straight-forward: be a leader in efficient and lower carbon production of traditional energy, in high demand today and for decades to come, while growing lower carbon businesses that will be a bigger part of the future. To achieve these goals, we’ll build on the assets, experience, capabilities, and relationships we’ve developed over 140 years to incubate and grow new business.
Technology will play a crucial role in unlocking ever cleaner and more affordable sources of energy. Chevron is seeking innovative, technology professionals with a desire to thrive in the global digital environment and help us lead the global energy transition.
An IT career at Chevron offers you the opportunity to work in a technical environment with a global reach. You’ll find that we make a business of investing in our people and encouraging your professional development through a learning culture and challenging on-the-job opportunities. We differentiate ourselves through the application of cutting-edge technology, and by taking a collaborative approach that includes in-house expertise, proprietary solutions, and strategic partnerships. We also offer flexible work schedules and very competitive benefits.
Join Chevron IT. Lend us your skills and enjoy a great career with Chevron.
Multiple positions available, based on domain experience and technical capabilities.
For some positions, the successful candidate must be able to pass requirements to acquire a Transportation Worker Identification Credential (TWICs) card.
Available Locations: Bakersfield, CA / San Ramon, CA / Richmond, CA / Houston, TX / Midland, TX / Covington, LA / Belle Chase, LA / Pascagoula, MS / Calgary (Canada)
Responsibilities for this position may include but are not limited to:
Supports the software development lifecycle for software solutions
Deploys, configures, and supports business applications
Configures, customizes, and integrates vendor-sourced enterprise software with other internal systems
Updates existing code to debug or incorporate minor enhancements
Develops deep domain knowledge by understanding business processes.
Elicits business requirements and translates business needs into fit-for-purpose actionable plans.
Actively participates in an integrated DevOps Team utilizing Agile methodologies with strong change management focus.
Provides daily operational support for several applications by troubleshooting incidents to identify root causes and solutions, identifying and resolving problems, designing and implementing configuration changes and monitoring performance.
Proactive communication and quick response to production issues and project work. Strong customer focus.
Monitors interfaces/data loads, administer security, and provide feedback/solutions on application performance.
Identifies areas for improvement and partners with Software Engineers/team members to address tactical and strategic issues.
Develops and maintains support documentation.
Maintains IP Compliance on systems and software as appropriate.
Required Qualifications:
5+ years industry relevant experience
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Systems or related fields.
Demonstrated application of strong analytical and problem-solving skills to help the team identify, communicate, and resolve issues
Skilled in scripting to automate workflow, and in low code development platforms
Experience providing design, testing and implementation support for and participation in internally driven platform deployment or lifecycle projects, and/or customer-facing projects
Knowledge and hands-on experience in two or more of the following is a plus: Power Apps, Power BI, C#, C++, Angular, Node.js, SQL, Ansible, R, Java, Python, Azure, APIs, Web services (WCF and/or RESTful services), Web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript), SQL Server, SAP FI/CO, SD/SD-ISOil, MM/MM-ISOil, PM/AM, EWM, among others.
Motivated, flexible, self-directed, works with minimal supervision, and a high degree of ownership
Strong communication (written/verbal) and facilitation skills with solid ability to convey business and technical information to a diverse audience
Organized and skilled at planning; ability to work from a high-level to a low level of detail and handle multiple assignments with varying priorities and deadlines while maintaining calm composure under pressure
Experience/knowledge in Agile SAFe, Kanban and Scrum methodologies
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledgeable in configuring APIs to integrate systems both on premise and in the cloud.
Experience with custom objects, programs, interfaces, activating and generating pre-defined reports and analytics.
Experience in deployment of new solutions and applications, including training and support
